section.title: Projects
section.para: The photos, music soundtrack, transition and effect selections and other settings that make up a show can be saved in a PhotoPulse project file. You can reopen the project later and continue working on it, adding a few more photos or changing the music and other settings. If you open and modify a project, you can then save your changes replacing the existing project file, or save as a new project file without changing the original. See for more information on project related menu items.

The project file does not actually store your photos and MP3, it references the original photo and MP3 files on your disk - only the file names are stored in the project. If you move the photos or MP3, then when you open the project file later it will not be able to locate those files. If you load photos from a CDROM directly into a PhotoPulse show, then when you reopen that project you will need to have the CDROM inserted. Because of this, it is usually better to copy the photos from the CDROM onto your hard disk and load them into PhotoPulse from there.

A good way to organize the files for a PhotoPulse project is like this:
+ Birthday Show/ | + Birthday Show.ppp + photos/ |---photo1.jpg |---photo2.jpg |---[...] |---photoN.jpg + music/ |---song.mp3
This way the project file and the photos and MP3 it references are all contained within the same folder (Birthday Show). This folder can then be renamed or moved without breaking the link between the project file and the photos it references.
